clusters.title: Mexico reacts to man groping President as complaint filed against him
clusters.neutral_headline: Mexican President Files Complaint After Public Groping Incident

items.title: Mexico reacts to man groping President as complaint filed against him
items.standfirst: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has filed a complaint against a man who groped and tried to kiss her as she greeted members of the public, a day after a video of the incident went viral. It happened in the capital's historic centre as Latin America's first woman leader made the short walk from Mexico's national palace to the Ministry of Education.
items.content: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has filed a complaint against a man who groped and tried to kiss her as she greeted members of the public, a day after a video of the incident went viral. It happened in the capital's historic centre as Latin America's first woman leader made the short walk from Mexico's national palace to the Ministry of Education.

items.title: Video Shows Mexican President Sheinbaum Sexually Harassed in Street
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum is pressing charges against a man who was caught on camera touching and attempting to kiss her during a public appearance on Tuesday. Footage captured close to the National Palace in Mexico City showed a man approaching Sheinbaum as she spoke with a gathered…
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum is pressing charges against a man who was caught on camera touching and attempting to kiss her during a public appearance on Tuesday. items.title: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum presses charges after groping attack
items.standfirst: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has filed a complaint after she was groped by a man on the street.
items.content: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has filed a complaint after she was groped by a man on the street.

items.title: Groping of President Claudia Sheinbaum spotlights violence against women in Mexico
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Wednesday she had filed a complaint against a man who groped her and tried to kiss her. Video of the incident went viral before being taken down by some accounts, underscoring for many in Mexico the insecurity women face in a country steeped in machismo and gender-based violence.
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Wednesday she had filed a complaint against a man who groped her and tried to kiss her. Video of the incident went viral before being taken down by some accounts, underscoring for many in Mexico the insecurity women face in a country steeped in machismo and gender-based violence.

items.title: Mexican president to press charges after video shows her being groped
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that she will press charges against a man who appears to grope her while she was walking between government buildings in Mexico City, where a crowd had gathered. Police arrested the suspect, who can be seen trying to kiss the president before reaching for her chest. The country has faced elevated rates of gender-based violence, as well as violence against local politicians.
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that she will press charges against a man who appears to grope her while she was walking between government buildings in Mexico City, where a crowd had gathered. Police arrested the suspect, who can be seen trying to kiss the president before reaching for her chest. The country has faced elevated rates of gender-based violence, as well as violence against local politicians.

items.title: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum presses charges after being groped in street
items.standfirst: In Mexico, a man who groped President Sheinbaum and tried to kiss her is in police custody. The incident is reigniting a national and global conversation about harassment. NBC News’ Ellison Barber has the story.
items.content: In Mexico, a man who groped President Sheinbaum and tried to kiss her is in police custody. The incident is reigniting a national and global conversation about harassment. NBC News’ Ellison Barber has the story.

items.title: Mexico president to seek charges after being groped on street

items.content: Claudia Sheinbaum says she is pressing charges because "a line must be drawn" against the harassment of Mexican women.

items.title: Man arrested after groping Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum on street

items.content: Mexico President Claudia Sheinbaum says the harassment she suffered from a drunk man near the government seat is an assault on all women.

items.title: Man gropes Mexican president as she speaks to citizens on the streets
items.standfirst: Man tries to kiss and embrace Claudia Sheinbaum, highlighting security risk and harassment women face in MexicoThe Mexican president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has been groped by a man as she mingled with citizens on the streets of Mexico City, raising questions about the lack of presidential security and the level of sexual harassment the country’s women face.A video of the incident on Tuesday shows a visibly drunk man trying to kiss the president on the neck and embrace her from behind, as she removes his hands and turns to face him, before a government official steps in and places himself between them. Continue reading...
items.content: Man tries to kiss and embrace Claudia Sheinbaum, highlighting security risk and harassment women face in MexicoThe Mexican president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has been groped by a man as she mingled with citizens on the streets of Mexico City, raising questions about the lack of presidential security and the level of sexual harassment the country’s women face.A video of the incident on Tuesday shows a visibly drunk man trying to kiss the president on the neck and embrace her from behind, as she removes his hands and turns to face him, before a government official steps in and places himself between them. Continue reading...

Police arrested the suspect who attempted to kiss the president before groping her.
The incident highlights the issue of gender-based violence in Mexico.

clusters.title: US Supreme Court expresses scepticism over Trump's reciprocal tariffs
clusters.neutral_headline: Supreme Court Hears Arguments on Trump's Tariffs

items.title: US Supreme Court expresses scepticism over Trump's reciprocal tariffs
items.standfirst: On Wednesday, the US Supreme Court's chief justices heard arguments over the legality of tariffs enacted by President Donald Trump using the Emergency Economic Powers Act, and questioned the reasoning of the administration. In this edition, we look at what the Court's decision could mean for the US economy, public finances and trade negotiations. Also in the show, we meet the French businesses targeted by fake Google review scams.
items.content: On Wednesday, the US Supreme Court's chief justices heard arguments over the legality of tariffs enacted by President Donald Trump using the Emergency Economic Powers Act, and questioned the reasoning of the administration. In this edition, we look at what the Court's decision could mean for the US economy, public finances and trade negotiations. Also in the show, we meet the French businesses targeted by fake Google review scams.

items.title: Trump’s supreme court strategy is to redefine ‘tariffs’. Will the justices buy it?
items.standfirst: The fate of the US president’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy is in the hands of a court he shapedDonald Trump faced arguably the biggest test so far of his contentious use of executive power at the US supreme court on Wednesday. The stakes could not be higher – “literally, LIFE OR DEATH” for the US, at least according to the president.Trump’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy, his sweeping tariffs regime, was in the dock – specifically, the legal mechanism his administration has used to enforce it. And the man dispatched to defend the White House put forward a somewhat puzzling argument. Continue reading...
items.content: The fate of the US president’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy is in the hands of a court he shapedDonald Trump faced arguably the biggest test so far of his contentious use of executive power at the US supreme court on Wednesday. The stakes could not be higher – “literally, LIFE OR DEATH” for the US, at least according to the president.Trump’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy, his sweeping tariffs regime, was in the dock – specifically, the legal mechanism his administration has used to enforce it. items.title: Supreme Court justices seem skeptical of Trump's sweeping tariffs

items.content: The Supreme Court heard arguments Wednesday over whether a federal emergency powers law authorizes President Trump's most sweeping tariffs.

items.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says "future of capitalism" at stake in Supreme Court tariffs case
items.standfirst: The Supreme Court sounded skeptical on Wednesday about President Trump's sweeping tariff agenda. Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota attended the hearing and joins "The Takeout" with her takeaways.
items.content: The Supreme Court sounded skeptical on Wednesday about President Trump's sweeping tariff agenda. Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota attended the hearing and joins "The Takeout" with her takeaways.

items.title: US supreme court justices express skepticism over legality of Trump tariffs
items.standfirst: Justices grill administration over imposition of steep duties as Sotomayor says: ‘I just don’t understand this argument’The US supreme court appeared skeptical of the legal basis of the Trump administration’s sweeping global tariff regime on Wednesday after justices questioned the president’s authority to impose the levies.Justices heard oral arguments on Wednesday morning on the legality of Donald Trump’s tariffs , a crucial legal test of his controversial economic strategy – and power. Continue reading...
items.content: Justices grill administration over imposition of steep duties as Sotomayor says: ‘I just don’t understand this argument’The US supreme court appeared skeptical of the legal basis of the Trump administration’s sweeping global tariff regime on Wednesday after justices questioned the president’s authority to impose the levies.Justices heard oral arguments on Wednesday morning on the legality of Donald Trump’s tariffs , a crucial legal test of his controversial economic strategy – and power. clusters.title: State of emergency declared in the Philippines after Typhoon Kalmaegi
clusters.neutral_headline: Philippines Declares State of Emergency After Typhoon Kalmaegi

items.title: State of emergency declared in the Philippines after Typhoon Kalmaegi
items.standfirst: Philippines President has declared a state of calamity after Typhoon Kalmaegi wreaked havoc on the country. Leaving at least 142 dead, and another 127 people missing, making it the deadliest typhoon so far of 2025. The region is no stranger to typhoons: the Philippines has seen around 20 this season and could face 3 or 5 more by the end of 2025. Another, potentially even stronger typhoon, Tropical Storm Fung-wong is advancing on the country.
items.content: Philippines President has declared a state of calamity after Typhoon Kalmaegi wreaked havoc on the country. Leaving at least 142 dead, and another 127 people missing, making it the deadliest typhoon so far of 2025. The region is no stranger to typhoons: the Philippines has seen around 20 this season and could face 3 or 5 more by the end of 2025. Another, potentially even stronger typhoon, Tropical Storm Fung-wong is advancing on the country.

items.title: Philippines declares state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi death toll passes 100
items.standfirst: The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, with 127 people still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of CebuPhilippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi left at least 114 people dead and nearly 130 missing in central provinces in the deadliest natural disaster to hit the country this year.The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, and 127 people were still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of Cebu. The tropical cyclone blew out of the archipelago on Wednesday into the South China Sea. Continue reading...

items.title: 2 elderly lions euthanized, fate of 5 more uncertain after wildlife sanctuary hit by financial woes
items.standfirst: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary says it has euthanized two of its seven elderly lions after closing for financial reasons, with five more at risk of the same fate.
items.content: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary says it has euthanized two of its seven elderly lions after closing for financial reasons, with five more at risk of the same fate.

items.title: Troubled New Zealand wildlife park euthanizes two lions, fate of five more unclear
items.standfirst: Members of the public have pleaded for a reprieve for the remaining lions, while former staff members hope the sanctuary will reconsider putting them downA troubled New Zealand wildlife park says it has been forced to euthanise two of its elderly lions, with the fate of its remaining five lions unclear, after it ran into financial difficulties.The privately owned Kamo Wildlife Sanctuary in the northern city of Whangārei closed its doors on the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: Members of the public have pleaded for a reprieve for the remaining lions, while former staff members hope the sanctuary will reconsider putting them downA troubled New Zealand wildlife park says it has been forced to euthanise two of its elderly lions, with the fate of its remaining five lions unclear, after it ran into financial difficulties.The privately owned Kamo Wildlife Sanctuary in the northern city of Whangārei closed its doors on the weekend. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary euthanized two elderly lions.
The sanctuary closed due to financial difficulties.
Five more lions are at risk of the same fate.
The public has pleaded for the remaining lions' survival.
The sanctuary is located in Whangārei.

clusters.title: China Assessing Damage After Spaceship Hit by Debris
clusters.neutral_headline: Chinese Astronauts' Return Delayed After Spacecraft Incident

items.title: China Assessing Damage After Spaceship Hit by Debris
items.standfirst: The Shenzhou-20's crew was scheduled to return home Wednesday at the end of their six-month mission aboard China's space station.
items.content: The Shenzhou-20's crew was scheduled to return home Wednesday at the end of their six-month mission aboard China's space station.

items.title: Return of Chinese astronauts delayed after spacecraft struck by debris
items.standfirst: The three astronauts from the Shenzhou-20 mission flew to the Tiangong space station in April, and were expected to return on WednesdayThe return to Earth of three Chinese astronauts has been delayed until an unspecified date after their spacecraft was apparently struck by a small piece of debris, according to Chinese state media.The three astronauts from the Shenzhou-20 mission flew to the Tiangong space station in April, and were expected to return on Wednesday at the end of a six month mission. Their replacements, the crew of Shenzhou-21, had already arrived on the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: The three astronauts from the Shenzhou-20 mission flew to the Tiangong space station in April, and were expected to return on WednesdayThe return to Earth of three Chinese astronauts has been delayed until an unspecified date after their spacecraft was apparently struck by a small piece of debris, according to Chinese state media.The three astronauts from the Shenzhou-20 mission flew to the Tiangong space station in April, and were expected to return on Wednesday at the end of a six month mission. Their replacements, the crew of Shenzhou-21, had already arrived on the weekend. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Shenzhou-20 crew's return to Earth was delayed after a possible debris strike.
The mission was scheduled to conclude after six months on China's space station.
The Shenzhou-21 crew had already arrived at the Tiangong space station.
Chinese state media reported the delay, but did not specify a new return date.
The spacecraft was struck by a small piece of debris, according to reports.

clusters.title: Chinese-made buses can be halted remotely in Norway, spurring increased security
clusters.neutral_headline: Chinese Buses Can Be Halted Remotely, Raising Security Concerns

items.title: Chinese-made buses can be halted remotely in Norway, spurring increased security
items.standfirst: Test results showed that the Chinese bus maker had access to the vehicles' control systems for software updates and diagnostics.
items.content: Test results showed that the Chinese bus maker had access to the vehicles' control systems for software updates and diagnostics.

items.title: Danish authorities in rush to close security loophole in Chinese electric buses
items.standfirst: Investigation launched after discovery that Chinese supplier had remote access to vehicles’ control systemsAuthorities in Denmark are urgently studying how to close an apparent security loophole in hundreds of Chinese-made electric buses that enables them to be remotely deactivated.The investigation comes after transport authorities in Norway, where the Yutong buses are also in service, found that the Chinese supplier had remote access for software updates and diagnostics to the vehicles’ control systems – which could be exploited to affect buses while in transit. Continue reading...
items.content: Investigation launched after discovery that Chinese supplier had remote access to vehicles’ control systemsAuthorities in Denmark are urgently studying how to close an apparent security loophole in hundreds of Chinese-made electric buses that enables them to be remotely deactivated.The investigation comes after transport authorities in Norway, where the Yutong buses are also in service, found that the Chinese supplier had remote access for software updates and diagnostics to the vehicles’ control systems – which could be exploited to affect buses while in transit. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Tests showed the Chinese bus maker had remote access to control systems.
Authorities in Denmark are investigating a security loophole in electric buses.
The loophole could allow remote deactivation of the buses while in transit.
Norway found the Chinese supplier had remote access for software updates.
The buses are made by Yutong and are in service in multiple countries.

items.standfirst: Thailand’s King Maha Vajiralongkorn is set to make the first state visit by a Thai monarch to China at the invitation of President Xi Jinping, as the two nations mark 50 years of diplomatic relations.
items.content: Thailand’s King Maha Vajiralongkorn is set to make the first state visit by a Thai monarch to China at the invitation of President Xi Jinping, as the two nations mark 50 years of diplomatic relations.

This will be the first state visit by a Thai monarch to China.
The visit is considered a historic event for both countries.

items.title: Rachel Reeves ‘planning pay-per-mile tax for electric vehicles in budget’
items.standfirst: EV drivers would face 3p-a-mile charge on top of other road taxes to offset falling revenue from petrol and diesel cars Rachel Reeves is drawing up plans for a new pay-per-mile tax for electric vehicles to announce in this month’s budget worth an extra £250 a year on average, according to reports.Under the plans expected to be announced on 26 November, EV drivers would face a new charge of 3p a mile on top of other road taxes to offset falling revenue from petrol and diesel cars as drivers switch to greener options. Continue reading...
items.content: EV drivers would face 3p-a-mile charge on top of other road taxes to offset falling revenue from petrol and diesel cars Rachel Reeves is drawing up plans for a new pay-per-mile tax for electric vehicles to announce in this month’s budget worth an extra £250 a year on average, according to reports.Under the plans expected to be announced on 26 November, EV drivers would face a new charge of 3p a mile on top of other road taxes to offset falling revenue from petrol and diesel cars as drivers switch to greener options. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Rachel Reeves is planning a pay-per-mile tax for electric vehicles.
The tax would be announced in the upcoming budget.
EV drivers would pay 3p per mile on top of other road taxes.
The tax aims to offset falling revenue from petrol and diesel cars.
The tax could add approximately £250 per year for EV drivers.

clusters.title: Putin says Russia is considering resuming nuclear tests following Trump's remarks
clusters.neutral_headline: Putin Considers Resuming Nuclear Tests After Trump Remarks

items.title: Putin says Russia is considering resuming nuclear tests following Trump's remarks
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that Russia would consider resuming nuclear tests for the first time since 1990 if the United States did so. US President Donald Trump said on social media last week that he had instructed the Pentagon to "start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis" with Russia and China.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that Russia would consider resuming nuclear tests for the first time since 1990 if the United States did so. US President Donald Trump said on social media last week that he had instructed the Pentagon to "start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis" with Russia and China.

items.title: Putin orders plans for resuming nuclear tests after Trump comments
items.standfirst: Vladimir Putin ordered his top officials on Wednesday to prepare for resumed nuclear testing, a direct response to President Donald Trump's likewise action.
items.content: Vladimir Putin ordered his top officials on Wednesday to prepare for resumed nuclear testing, a direct response to President Donald Trump's likewise action.

ai_summary: Vladimir Putin is considering resuming nuclear tests.
The decision is in response to comments by Donald Trump.
Trump said he instructed the Pentagon to test nuclear weapons.
Putin ordered officials to prepare for resumed nuclear testing.
Russia has not conducted nuclear tests since 1990.
